duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead the entire preconstruction process from start to finish, including estimating, scheduling, and bidding.
Participate in presentations to secure new projects and maintain knowledge of key contract terms.
Prepare detailed estimates and lead the value engineering process to align project scope to clients' budgets.
Analyze cost models during design development and create subcontractor/material supplier bid lists.
Coordinate and lead a team of preconstruction associates on larger projects and keep current on changes and trends in construction methods and materials.
Identify and qualify new material suppliers and subcontractors, participate in preconstruction strategy meetings, and assure detailed preconstruction and preliminary construction schedules.
Visit ongoing projects to verify estimates versus project status, meet with the project operations team, and understand bid/GMP process for project financial success.
Effectively communicate with owners, design professionals, and company associates, carrying oneself professionally in all meetings and interactions.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office suite of software, Timberline Estimating software, On-Screen Take-Off software, and an understanding of Building Information Modeling software.

5-10 years of experience in a preconstruction position successfully completing design build or construction management at risk projects with a Bachelor’s degree in a construction or architecture related degree.
LEED AP certification preferred, OSHA 30-hour certification preferred.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in a construction or architecture related degree (Master's preferred)
